adjective.description: Chiefly in the names of animals, especially fish: having a red belly or red underparts.

noun.description: Any of several North American minnows of the genus Phoxinus, which have red undersides, black and yellow stripes along the sides, and yellow fins; especially P. erythrogaster. Also with distinguishing word. Now rare.

Any of several dark-coloured American turtles of the genus Pseudemys (family Emydidae), typically having reddish coloration on at least the margins of the plastron; especially P. rubriventris of the eastern United States.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in John Leland (c1503–1552), poet and antiquary. From red + belly, originally after Welsh torgoch torgoch.
